speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Now, Hal, what time of day is it, lad?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou art so fat-witted with drinking of old

speaker: PRINCE
text: sack, and unbuttoning thee after supper, and

speaker: PRINCE
text: sleeping upon benches after noon, that thou hast

speaker: PRINCE
text: forgotten to demand that truly which thou wouldst

speaker: PRINCE
text: truly know. What a devil hast thou to do with

speaker: PRINCE
text: the time of the day? Unless hours were cups of

speaker: PRINCE
text: sack, and minutes capons, and clocks the tongues

speaker: PRINCE
text: of bawds, and dials the signs of leaping-houses,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and the blessed sun himself a fair hot wench in

speaker: PRINCE
text: flame-colored taffeta, I see no reason why thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: shouldst be so superfluous to demand the time

speaker: PRINCE
text: of the day.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Indeed, you come near me now, Hal, for we

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: that take purses go by the moon and the seven

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: stars, and not by Phoebus, he, that wand’ring

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: knight so fair. And I prithee, sweet wag, when thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: art king, as God save thy Grace—Majesty, I should

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: say, for grace thou wilt have none—

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, none?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, by my troth, not so much as will serve to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: be prologue to an egg and butter.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, how then? Come, roundly, roundly.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Marry then, sweet wag, when thou art king,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: let not us that are squires of the night’s body be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: called thieves of the day’s beauty. Let us be Diana’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: foresters, gentlemen of the shade, minions of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: moon, and let men say we be men of good government,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: being governed, as the sea is, by our noble

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and chaste mistress the moon, under whose countenance

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: we steal.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou sayest well, and it holds well too, for the

speaker: PRINCE
text: fortune of us that are the moon’s men doth ebb and

speaker: PRINCE
text: flow like the sea, being governed, as the sea is, by

speaker: PRINCE
text: the moon. As for proof now: a purse of gold most

speaker: PRINCE
text: resolutely snatched on Monday night and most

speaker: PRINCE
text: dissolutely spent on Tuesday morning, got with

speaker: PRINCE
text: swearing “Lay by” and spent with crying “Bring

speaker: PRINCE
text: in”; now in as low an ebb as the foot of the ladder,

speaker: PRINCE
text: and by and by in as high a flow as the ridge of the

speaker: PRINCE
text: gallows.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: By the Lord, thou sayst true, lad. And is not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: my hostess of the tavern a most sweet wench?

speaker: PRINCE
text: As the honey of Hybla, my old lad of the castle.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And is not a buff jerkin a most sweet robe of

speaker: PRINCE
text: durance?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How now, how now, mad wag? What, in thy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: quips and thy quiddities? What a plague have I to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: do with a buff jerkin?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Why, what a pox have I to do with my hostess

speaker: PRINCE
text: of the tavern?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, thou hast called her to a reckoning

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: many a time and oft.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Did I ever call for thee to pay thy part?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, I’ll give thee thy due. Thou hast paid all

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: there.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, and elsewhere, so far as my coin would

speaker: PRINCE
text: stretch, and where it would not, I have used my

speaker: PRINCE
text: credit.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, and so used it that were it not here

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: apparent that thou art heir apparent—But I prithee,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sweet wag, shall there be gallows standing in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: England when thou art king? And resolution thus

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fubbed as it is with the rusty curb of old father Antic

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the law? Do not thou, when thou art king, hang a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thief.

speaker: PRINCE
text: No, thou shalt.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Shall I? O rare! By the Lord, I’ll be a brave

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: judge.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou judgest false already. I mean thou shalt

speaker: PRINCE
text: have the hanging of the thieves, and so become a

speaker: PRINCE
text: rare hangman.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, Hal, well, and in some sort it jumps

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: with my humor as well as waiting in the court, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: can tell you.

speaker: PRINCE
text: For obtaining of suits?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, for obtaining of suits, whereof the hangman

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hath no lean wardrobe. ’Sblood, I am as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: melancholy as a gib cat or a lugged bear.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Or an old lion, or a lover’s lute.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, or the drone of a Lincolnshire bagpipe.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What sayest thou to a hare, or the melancholy

speaker: PRINCE
text: of Moorditch?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Thou hast the most unsavory similes, and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: art indeed the most comparative, rascaliest, sweet

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: young prince. But, Hal, I prithee trouble me no

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: more with vanity. I would to God thou and I knew

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: where a commodity of good names were to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bought. An old lord of the council rated me the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: other day in the street about you, sir, but I marked

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: him not, and yet he talked very wisely, but I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: regarded him not, and yet he talked wisely, and in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the street, too.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou didst well, for wisdom cries out in the

speaker: PRINCE
text: streets and no man regards it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: O, thou hast damnable iteration, and art

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: indeed able to corrupt a saint. Thou hast done

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: much harm upon me, Hal, God forgive thee for it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Before I knew thee, Hal, I knew nothing, and now

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: am I, if a man should speak truly, little better than

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: one of the wicked. I must give over this life, and I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: will give it over. By the Lord, an I do not, I am a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: villain. I’ll be damned for never a king’s son in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Christendom.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Where shall we take a purse tomorrow, Jack?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Zounds, where thou wilt, lad. I’ll make one.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: An I do not, call me villain and baffle me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I see a good amendment of life in thee, from

speaker: PRINCE
text: praying to purse-taking.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why, Hal, ’tis my vocation, Hal. ’Tis no sin

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: for a man to labor in his vocation.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Poins!—Now shall we know if Gadshill have set a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: match. O, if men were to be saved by merit, what

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hole in hell were hot enough for him? This is the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: most omnipotent villain that ever cried “Stand!” to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a true man.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Good morrow, Ned.

speaker: POINS
text: Good morrow, sweet Hal.—What says Monsieur

speaker: POINS
text: Remorse? What says Sir John Sack-and-Sugar?

speaker: POINS
text: Jack, how agrees the devil and thee about

speaker: POINS
text: thy soul that thou soldest him on Good Friday last

speaker: POINS
text: for a cup of Madeira and a cold capon’s leg?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Sir John stands to his word. The devil shall

speaker: PRINCE
text: have his bargain, for he was never yet a breaker of

speaker: PRINCE
text: proverbs. He will give the devil his due.

speaker: POINS
text: Then art thou damned for keeping

speaker: POINS
text: thy word with the devil.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Else he had been damned for cozening the

speaker: PRINCE
text: devil.

speaker: POINS
text: But, my lads, my lads, tomorrow morning, by

speaker: POINS
text: four o’clock early at Gad’s Hill, there are pilgrims

speaker: POINS
text: going to Canterbury with rich offerings, and traders

speaker: POINS
text: riding to London with fat purses. I have vizards for

speaker: POINS
text: you all. You have horses for yourselves. Gadshill lies

speaker: POINS
text: tonight in Rochester. I have bespoke supper tomorrow

speaker: POINS
text: night in Eastcheap. We may do it as secure as

speaker: POINS
text: sleep. If you will go, I will stuff your purses full of

speaker: POINS
text: crowns. If you will not, tarry at home and be

speaker: POINS
text: hanged.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hear you, Yedward, if I tarry at home and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: go not, I’ll hang you for going.

speaker: POINS
text: You will, chops?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hal, wilt thou make one?

speaker: PRINCE
text: Who, I rob? I a thief? Not I, by my faith.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: There’s neither honesty, manhood, nor

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: good fellowship in thee, nor thou cam’st not of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the blood royal, if thou darest not stand for ten

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: shillings.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well then, once in my days I’ll be a madcap.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why, that’s well said.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, come what will, I’ll tarry at home.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: By the Lord, I’ll be a traitor then when thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: art king.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I care not.

speaker: POINS
text: Sir John, I prithee leave the Prince and me

speaker: POINS
text: alone. I will lay him down such reasons for this

speaker: POINS
text: adventure that he shall go.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, God give thee the spirit of persuasion,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and him the ears of profiting, that what thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: speakest may move, and what he hears may be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: believed, that the true prince may, for recreation

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: sake, prove a false thief, for the poor abuses of the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: time want countenance. Farewell. You shall find me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in Eastcheap.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Farewell, thou latter spring. Farewell, Allhallown

speaker: PRINCE
text: summer.

speaker: POINS
text: Now, my good sweet honey lord, ride with us

speaker: POINS
text: tomorrow. I have a jest to execute that I cannot

speaker: POINS
text: manage alone. Falstaff, Peto, Bardolph, and Gadshill

speaker: POINS
text: shall rob those men that we have already

speaker: POINS
text: waylaid. Yourself and I will not be there. And when

speaker: POINS
text: they have the booty, if you and I do not rob them,

speaker: POINS
text: cut this head off from my shoulders.

speaker: PRINCE
text: How shall we part with them in setting forth?

speaker: POINS
text: Why, we will set forth before or after them, and

speaker: POINS
text: appoint them a place of meeting, wherein it is at our

speaker: POINS
text: pleasure to fail; and then will they adventure upon

speaker: POINS
text: the exploit themselves, which they shall have no

speaker: POINS
text: sooner achieved but we’ll set upon them.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, but ’tis like that they will know us by our

speaker: PRINCE
text: horses, by our habits, and by every other appointment

speaker: PRINCE
text: to be ourselves.

speaker: POINS
text: Tut, our horses they shall not see; I’ll tie them

speaker: POINS
text: in the wood. Our vizards we will change after we

speaker: POINS
text: leave them. And, sirrah, I have cases of buckram

speaker: POINS
text: for the nonce, to immask our noted outward

speaker: POINS
text: garments.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Yea, but I doubt they will be too hard for us.

speaker: POINS
text: Well, for two of them, I know them to be as

speaker: POINS
text: true-bred cowards as ever turned back; and for the

speaker: POINS
text: third, if he fight longer than he sees reason, I’ll

speaker: POINS
text: forswear arms. The virtue of this jest will be the

speaker: POINS
text: incomprehensible lies that this same fat rogue will

speaker: POINS
text: tell us when we meet at supper: how thirty at least

speaker: POINS
text: he fought with, what wards, what blows, what

speaker: POINS
text: extremities he endured; and in the reproof of this

speaker: POINS
text: lives the jest.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Well, I’ll go with thee. Provide us all things

speaker: PRINCE
text: necessary and meet me tomorrow night in Eastcheap.

speaker: PRINCE
text: There I’ll sup. Farewell.

speaker: POINS
text: Farewell, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text:
I
               
              know
               
              you
               
              all
              ,
               
              and
               
              will
               
              awhile
               
              uphold

speaker: PRINCE
text:
The
               
              unyoked
               
              humor
               
              of
               
              your
               
              idleness
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Yet
               
              herein
               
              will
               
              I
               
              imitate
               
              the
               
              sun
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Who
               
              doth
               
              permit
               
              the
               
              base
               
              contagious
               
              clouds

speaker: PRINCE
text:
To
               
              smother
               
              up
               
              his
               
              beauty
               
              from
               
              the
               
              world
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
That
              ,
               
              when
               
              he
               
              please
               
              again
               
              to
               
              be
               
              himself
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Being
               
              wanted
              ,
               
              he
               
              may
               
              be
               
              more
               
              wondered
               
              at

speaker: PRINCE
text:
By
               
              breaking
               
              through
               
              the
               
              foul
               
              and
               
              ugly
               
              mists

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Of
               
              vapors
               
              that
               
              did
               
              seem
               
              to
               
              strangle
               
              him
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
If
               
              all
               
              the
               
              year
               
              were
               
              playing
               
              holidays
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
To
               
              sport
               
              would
               
              be
               
              as
               
              tedious
               
              as
               
              to
               
              work
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
But
               
              when
               
              they
               
              seldom
               
              come
              ,
               
              they
               
              wished-for
               
              come
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
               
              nothing
               
              pleaseth
               
              but
               
              rare
               
              accidents
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
So
               
              when
               
              this
               
              loose
               
              behavior
               
              I
               
              throw
               
              off

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
               
              pay
               
              the
               
              debt
               
              I
               
              never
               
              promisèd
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
By
               
              how
               
              much
               
              better
               
              than
               
              my
               
              word
               
              I
               
              am
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
By
               
              so
               
              much
               
              shall
               
              I
               
              falsify
               
              men’s
               
              hopes
              ;

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
              ,
               
              like
               
              bright
               
              metal
               
              on
               
              a
               
              sullen
               
              ground
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
My
               
              reformation
              ,
               
              glitt’ring
               
              o’er
               
              my
               
              fault
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Shall
               
              show
               
              more
               
              goodly
               
              and
               
              attract
               
              more
               
              eyes

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Than
               
              that
               
              which
               
              hath
               
              no
               
              foil
               
              to
               
              set
               
              it
               
              off
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
I’ll
               
              so
               
              offend
               
              to
               
              make
               
              offense
               
              a
               
              skill
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Redeeming
               
              time
               
              when
               
              men
               
              think
               
              least
               
              I
               
              will
              .
